meanings.definition: Release from a duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: After completing his service, he received his discharge.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was granted a discharge from the army.
meanings.sent3: The discharge from jury duty was a relief for him.
meanings.sent4: Her discharge from the contract was a weight off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The discharge from his responsibilities felt liberating.

meanings.sent1: The factory discharge polluted the river.
meanings.sent2: The volcano discharge ash and lava.
meanings.sent3: The discharge of bubbles from the soda was fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent4: The gun discharge echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The discharge of fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.sent1: He learned how to discharge a rifle at the shooting range.
meanings.sent2: The soldier had to discharge his weapon in combat.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain ordered his crew to discharge their cannons.
meanings.sent4: The police officer had to discharge his firearm to stop the criminal.
meanings.sent5: The hunter carefully discharged his shotgun.

meanings.definition: Allow (a liquid, gas, or other substance) to flow out from where it has been confined.
meanings.sent1: The plumber had to discharge the water from the clogged pipe.
meanings.sent2: The dam had to discharge excess water to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent3: The soda can discharge its contents when shaken.
meanings.sent4: The doctor had to discharge the pus from the wound.
meanings.sent5: The air conditioner discharge cool air into the room.
